t: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.
The*p king shall joy in thy strength, O Lord;*s and in thy salvation how greatly shall he rejoice!
Thou*p hast given him his heart's desire, and hast not withholden the request of his lips. Selah.
For*p thou preventest him with the blessings of goodness: thou settest a crown of pure gold on his head.
He*p asked life of thee, and thou gavest it him, even length of days for ever and ever.
His*p glory is great in thy salvation: honour and majesty hast thou laid upon him.
For*p thou hast made him most blessed for ever: thou hast made him exceeding glad with thy countenance.
For*p the king trusteth in the Lord,*s and through the mercy of the most High he shall not be moved.
Thine*p hand shall find out all thine enemies: thy right hand shall find out those that hate thee.
Thou*p shalt make them as a fiery oven in the time of thine anger: the Lord*s shall swallow them up in his wrath, and the fire shall devour them.
Their*p fruit shalt thou destroy from the earth, and their seed from among the children of men.
For*p they intended evil against thee: they imagined a mischievous device, which they are not able to perform.
Therefore*p shalt thou make them turn their back, when thou shalt make ready thine arrows upon thy strings against the face of them.
Be*p thou exalted, Lord,*s in thine own strength: so will we sing and praise thy power.
